newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Apr natgas prices gain on storage buying--NGC.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Apr natgas prices gain on storage buying--NGC.

text.p: U.S. spot natural gas prices scored modest gains in April, boosted by accelerated storage injections and higher alternate fuel pricing, Natural Gas Clearinghouse (NGC) said in its monthly survey.
U.S. spot gas prices for April averaged $1.73 per million British thermal units, up eight cents from March's average of $1.65 but still well-below last April's average of $2.32, NGC said.
The largest monthly gains were in Oklahoma, where prices on pipelines like Northern Natural in Beaver County rose 15 cents for the month to $1.70, still 35 cents under last year.
Most Gulf pipes were up by five to 10 cents for the month but remained 70-90 cents below the same year-ago month.
Prices into Columbia Gas rose a nickel from March to $1.80, about 85 cents below last year's levels, NGC said.
Sales into El Paso Natural Gas in west Texas averaged $1.60, unchanged for the month and 50 cents below last year.

Prices represent NGC estimates of the median price for one month spot transactions at the indicated receipt points. The estimates are based upon quotes by industial end-users and local distribution companies, NGC said.
